title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS – On a night defined by a singular, historic force, Karl Malone delivered a performance for the ages, carrying the Utah Jazz to a heart-stopping 88-87 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.

"The Mailman" didn't just deliver; he was the entire postal service. Malone was an unstoppable force, pouring in a colossal 47 points and dominating the glass with 18 rebounds. His sheer will and physicality were the only constants for the Jazz, as he relentlessly attacked the basket against a Mavericks defense that had no answer.

While Malone authored his masterpiece, the game hung in the balance until the final second. Dallas, led by a gritty 19-point effort from George McCloud, refused to capitulate. They chipped away at the Utah lead, setting the stage for a dramatic finish that saw the Mavericks with a chance to steal the victory as the clock expired.

But ultimately, this night belonged to one man. Malone’s historic scoring barrage, a testament to power and precision, provided the necessary cushion to withstand Dallas’s final push. His 47 points were not just a number; they were the narrative, the reason the Jazz escaped with a narrow one-point triumph.

In the end, the story was simple: Karl Malone was inevitable, and on this night, 47 points were just enough.
